title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: The `sleep-debt-tracker` repository hosts a project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, designed to help users monitor and manage their sleep debt. It provides a user-friendly interface for logging sleep hours and visualizing the cumulative effect of sleep deficits over time, making it a practical tool for improving sleep habits. This project serves as a demonstration of applying TypeScript in a front-end web application.

title: devboard
description: Devboard is a full-stack web application built with Next.js 14 (using the Pages Router), TypeScript, and MUI, designed to serve as a personal project dashboard. It leverages React Query for efficient data fetching and management, providing a streamlined experience for organizing and tracking various development projects and tasks.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: Map-Visualisation is a project leveraging HTML and Python to create interactive and insightful map visualizations. This repository explores techniques for presenting geographical data in a user-friendly format, focusing on practical application and learning within the "project" topic. It aims to provide a foundation for understanding and implementing map-based data representation.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a CRUD application built with Python, Flask, and PostgreSQL, utilizing HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting for a complete web-based project experience. This repository showcases a functional implementation of Create, Read, Update, and Delete operations with a PostgreSQL database, providing a practical example for learning Python web development with a focus on database interactions and server-side logic.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a dynamic and interactive voting platform built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed to provide a seamless experience for creating and participating in polls. This project demonstrates a modern approach to web development, combining a robust backend with a user-friendly frontend for a real-time voting application.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project built using TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, demonstrating a modern and responsive dashboard interface with Next.js. It showcases best practices in front-end development, including component-based architecture, efficient data fetching, and visually appealing UI design. This repository serves as a practical example for developers looking to learn and implement Next.js in building interactive web applications and dashboards.

title: raven-v2
description: Raven-v2 is a project repository showcasing a full-stack application built with TypeScript and JavaScript.  This repository demonstrates modern web development practices and focuses on [insert brief, high-level purpose from README, e.g., "efficient task management," or "a streamlined e-commerce experience"]. It explores key concepts within the broader project landscape and serves as a demonstration of [mention a specific feature or concept, e.g., "reactive UI components," or "serverless API integration"].

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: Robofleet-dashboard is a web-based project built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS for visualizing and interacting with robotic fleet data. This dashboard provides a user-friendly interface to monitor robot status, view sensor data, and potentially control robots within a Robofleet system, focusing on real-time data presentation and intuitive controls for managing robotic operations.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a web application built with TypeScript, Vite, and Express.js, leveraging the Gemini API to provide interactive and insightful conversations. This project demonstrates the integration of AI-powered language models with modern web development technologies, offering a platform for exploring the capabilities of Gemini and experimenting with conversational AI interfaces. HTML, CSS, and JavaScript contribute to the front-end experience, creating a user-friendly interface for engaging with the AI.

title: resume
description: This repository contains my resume, built using TeX for a professional and customizable format. The project leverages LaTeX for document generation and includes an HTML version for online accessibility, serving as a showcase of my skills and experience.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting for visualizing and analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log files. This project provides a user-friendly interface to parse, filter, and display ROS logs, making it easier to debug and understand the behavior of ROS-based systems. It aims to improve the log analysis workflow within ROS projects by offering a more intuitive and efficient viewing experience.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: The `dynamic-event-calendar` repository, built with JavaScript, CSS, and HTML, provides a dynamic and interactive calendar application. This project focuses on creating a user-friendly interface for scheduling and displaying events, allowing users to easily manage and view their agenda within a visually appealing and responsive calendar.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: This repository contains a full-stack web application built with Next.js, TypeScript, and Supabase for tracking IoT assets in real-time. Utilizing Tailwind CSS for styling and JavaScript for dynamic functionality, the project provides a user interface for managing and monitoring asset locations and status, demonstrating a modern approach to IoT data visualization and interaction.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository, built using Jupyter Notebooks and Python, explores various finance-related projects. It serves as a collection of practical examples and analyses, demonstrating how Python can be used to solve real-world problems in finance, covering topics like data analysis, visualization, and potentially algorithmic trading or portfolio optimization.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-idea-board is a dynamic project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript designed to facilitate collaborative brainstorming and idea organization. This interactive idea board allows users to seamlessly add, categorize, and prioritize ideas, making it perfect for project planning, team collaboration, and personal brainstorming sessions. It leverages modern web development techniques to provide a responsive and engaging user experience, focusing on improving productivity and creative workflows.

title: atg-world
description: ATG-World is a web-based project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, focusing on interactive elements and potentially a dynamic user experience. This repository contains the source code for this project, leveraging modern web technologies to deliver [mention a specific feature or goal if you know it from the README, e.g., "an engaging virtual world exploration experience" or "a platform for collaborative storytelling"]. The project aims to explore [mention a specific topic addressed by the project, e.g., "game development techniques" or "front-end design patterns"] and provides a showcase of web development skills.

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-Seller is a fully-functional e-commerce project built with Next.js 14, utilizing the Pages Router, TypeScript, and React Query for efficient data fetching. This repository demonstrates best practices for building modern e-commerce applications, incorporating MUI for a polished user interface and showcasing type-safe development with TypeScript. The project focuses on providing a seamless fruit purchasing experience and serves as a practical example for developers looking to learn or implement similar features in their own e-commerce applications.
